Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which only anti-Trump protesters were arrested at the Million MAGA March, as there were individuals with different political affiliations who were also arrested.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that all those arrested were attacking Trump supporters, as the political affiliations of those arrested were not verified by the police.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that all those arrested were anti-Trump individuals, without considering the possibility of other affiliations or motivations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that both Trump supporters and anti-Trump protesters contributed to the outbreaks of violence at the event, as reported by published accounts.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that two individuals who were arrested with semiautomatic weapons were described by D.C. police as Trump supporters and members of a "militia," suggesting that not all those arrested were attacking Trump supporters.
Understate: The claim understates the involvement of Trump supporters in the violence by implying that only anti-Trump individuals were responsible, while ignoring instances where Trump supporters engaged in violent acts.
